meanings.definition: Make or become tight or taut.
meanings.sent1: She was tautening the rope to secure the tent.
meanings.sent2: He tautened the strings of the guitar before the performance.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was tautening its grip on the nut, determined not to let go.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was tautening, ready to snap at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation tautened as the deadline approached.

meanings.definition: To make taut or tense; tighten.
meanings.sent1: The tailor was tautening the fabric to ensure a perfect fit.
meanings.sent2: She tautened her grip on the steering wheel as she approached the sharp turn.
meanings.sent3: The magician tautened the rope, preparing for his daring escape act.
meanings.sent4: The atmosphere tautened as the final round of the competition began.
meanings.sent5: His muscles tautened as he lifted the heavy weight.
